sourcing.instructions: Cs (Cesium): Specialty chemical supplier; Ge (Germanium): Electronics components supplier; P (Phosphorus): Chemical supplier; Rb (Rubidium): Chemical supplier; Si (Silicon): Electronics components supplier.
steps: Cs (Cesium): Specialty chemical supplier; Ge (Germanium): Electronics components supplier; P (Phosphorus): Chemical supplier; Rb (Rubidium): Chemical supplier; Si (Silicon): Electronics components supplier.

1. Weigh each component using an analytical balance. 2. In a clean, dry environment, combine Cs, Ge, P, Rb, and Si in a ceramic mixing bowl. 3. Use a pestle and mortar to grind the mixture into a fine powder for uniformity.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Weigh each component using an analytical balance. 2. In a clean, dry environment, combine Cs, Ge, P, Rb, and Si in a ceramic mixing bowl. 3. Use a pestle and mortar to grind the mixture into a fine powder for uniformity.

steps: 1. Transfer the powder to a high-temperature resistant crucible. 2. Heat in a furnace to 1200 °C for 4 hours to ensure proper melting and mixing of components. 3. Monitor the temperature carefully to avoid overheating.
heating.raw_text: 1. Transfer the powder to a high-temperature resistant crucible. 2. Heat in a furnace to 1200 °C for 4 hours to ensure proper melting and mixing of components. 3. Monitor the temperature carefully to avoid overheating.

steps: 1. Turn off the furnace and allow it to cool to room temperature naturally (approximately 6-8 hours). 2. Do not open the furnace door until it has completely cooled to avoid thermal shock.
cooling.raw_text: 1. Turn off the furnace and allow it to cool to room temperature naturally (approximately 6-8 hours). 2. Do not open the furnace door until it has completely cooled to avoid thermal shock.

steps: 1. Remove the solid sample from the crucible. 2. Use a diamond saw to cut the material to the desired dimensions of 3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches. 3. Sand any rough edges for a smooth finish and seal with a protective lacquer if necessary.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Remove the solid sample from the crucible. 2. Use a diamond saw to cut the material to the desired dimensions of 3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches. 3. Sand any rough edges for a smooth finish and seal with a protective lacquer if necessary.
